root.TEXT:
Record date: 2096-08-09
CARDIOLOGY
YORK CONVALESCENT HOSPITAL
Reason for visit:
chest pain
Interval History:
Cardiologist: Hall
Mr. Innis is a 77 y/o man with h/o CAD s/p LAD stenting (Taxus Express 3.0x16mm) in 3/95. All other vessels had only minimal irregularities. Since that time, he has had only mild chest discomfort which is always relieved with nitroglycerin.
This morning, he had a more severe episode of chest pain accompanied by SOB and diaphoresis that started when walking to the dock after starting his boat. The pain was primarily in his back, similar to his angina prior to stenting. The pain lasted for approximately 30 min despite SL NTG, although did go away eventually. He had diaphoresis, SOB, and blurred vision associated with the pain. He was brought to the ED by his family. On arrival, he was pain free. P 60 BP 110/70. He was treated with ASA and Lopressor. EKG was unremarkable. Two sets of markers were negative. He is admitted to complete rule out MI and further diagnostic testing.
He currently denies pain and feels back to his baseline. He denies orthopnea, PND, LE swelling, + occasional palpitations, no syncope/near syncope.
Past medical history:
CAD as detailed above
COPD - followed by Dr. Yamashita, recently treated for H influenzae PNA
HTN
Hyperlipidemia
BPH
Medications (Confirmed):
Combivent 120/21mcg/spray inh qid
doxycycline 100mg po bid x 14 days
Ecotrin 325mg po daily
furosemide 20mg po daily
isosorbide mononitrate 30 mg sr po bid
K dur 20meq po daily
lisinopril 20mg po daily
nitroglycerin 0.4 mg sl every 5 minutes PRN chest pain
Plavix 75mg po daily
Proscar 5mg po daily
simvastatin 80mg po qpm
Singulair 10mg po daily
terazosin 10 mg po bid
Toprol xl 25 mg po daily
Allergies:
No known drug allergy
Family history:
noncontributing
Social history:
married, 5 children, former smoker - quit in 2060s, occasional EtOH
Review of systems:
+ chronic cough, + BPH sx, otherwise negative in detail unless mentioned in HPI
Physical examination:
-BMI: 33.4 Obese, high risk
-Pulse: 60
-resp. rate: 18 93% on RA
-height: 64 in.
-weight: 200 lbs.
-General: No acute distress.
-HEENT: Unremarkable
-Neck: Carotids 2+ without bruits. JVP no jugular venous distention.
-Chest: Few end expiratory wheezes. Otherwise, CTA bilaterally
-Cardiac: S4 with a normal S1 and S2, but no S3 or murmurs. No JVD. Carotid upstroke is brisk bilaterally.
-Abdomen: NABS, obese, soft, NT.
-Extremities: No edema, 2 dp and pt pulses, 2+ femoral pulses without bruits.
-BP: 162/55
-temp: 97.5
EKG:
NSR, TWNL. Unchanged compared to prior.
Selected recent labs:
Metabolic
Date NA K CL CO2 BUN CRE GLU CA PHOS MG
08/09/96 141 4.3 109 28.7 24 1.1 129 8.8 3.0 1.5
Cardiac enzymes
Date CK-MB TROP-I
08/09/96 NEGATIVE NEGATIVE
Hematology
Date HCT WBC PLT
08/09/96 33.4 7.3 172
Coagulation
Date PT PT-INR PTT
08/09/96 11.2 0.9 27.0
Other Data:
CXR: Clear lungs.
Assessment and plan:
Mr. Innis presents with a single episode of chest pain, similar to but more severe than his usual angina. His EKG is unchanged, and his cardiac markers are negative.
Plan:
1. CP/CAD - continue to rule out with third set of markers; continue ASA, Plavix, Bblocker, statin. Telemetry. NPO after midnight for possible stress test in am.
2. Anemia - guaiac stools, anemia labs, send blood bank sample.
3. HTN - due for pm Lisinopril dose. Continue home meds
4. COPD - appears at baseline. Continue home meds
Further plans in AM per Dr. Hall.
Fatema B. Wilkins, MD pager #80121
Signed electronically by Fatema B. Wilkins, MD
Document Status: Final
